Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Nanoporous core-shell composite with inherent micropore structure

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size admission and hydrophilic interaction chromatography (HILIC)

Other Information.Additional Info: Enriched from standard samples (tryptic digest of HRP) and endogenous glycopeptides in human saliva. Exhibit high sensitivity of 0.5 fmol μL−1.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size-exclusion, prevented from entering pore channels due to larger size.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Mixture with HRP tryptic digest at mass ratios of 1:100, 1:500, and 1:1000 (w/w)
Other Information.Additional Info: Effectively excluded even at high protein mass ratios (up to 1:1000 w/w).

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving based on pore aperture combined with hydrophilic interaction, excluding larger molecules (proteins) while admitting smaller molecules (glycopeptides).

Experimental Validation.Method: MALDI-TOF MS, nano-LC−MS/MS, Thermogravimetry analysis (TGA), Nitrogen adsorption/desorption measurement
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: High sensitivity (0.5 fmol μL−1 for glycopeptides), strong size-exclusion effect (up to 1:1000 w/w HRP digest/BSA protein), loading capacity: 30 mg g−1, glycopeptide recoveries: 84.9-90.4%, identified numerous endogenous glycopeptides (27-49) from human saliva samples.

Other Information.Additional Info: Magnetic covalent organic framework (COF) with inherent hydrophilicity, core-shell structure (COF shell on amino group-functionalized magnetite particles). Average thickness of COF layer: 31 nm. Saturation magnetization: 50.49 emu g−1. Good reusability and stability (preserved for 10 weeks).
